intro: Octomeria elobata, commonly known as the elongated octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Octomeria elobata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or shrubland habitats.
